p: Table 4 shows the design of the wheat ideotypes for raising genetic yield potential of winter wheat in 2050-climate and Fig. 2 shows the simulated yield potentials of those ideotypes. The mean yield potentials of wheat ideotype IW 2050 , designed for the 2050-climate ( HadGEM2, RCP8.5) under the water-limited condition, achieved 16.3 and 18.9 t ha −1 in the UK and NZ respectively. On average, yield potential of IW 2050 increased by 51% and 43% compared to CL Base and 31% and 34% than CL 2050 in the UK and NZ respectively. Grain yield potential of IW 2050 was 16% (2.6 t ha −1) higher in NZ than in the UK ( Fig. 2). The 95-percentile IW 2050 yield in the UK was up to 18.1 t ha −1 at RR and ED, whereas the highest 95-percentile yield in NZ was 21.3 t ha −1 at GO. Like CL Base , site difference in yield potential (variance) of IW 2050 was small in the UK (0.49 t ha −1) but greater in NZ (1.4 t ha −1). The mean yield potential of wheat ideotypes IP 2050 , designed for the 2050-climate under the potential condition, increased by 51% and 62% than CL Base in the UK and NZ respectively. Additional mean yield benefit of IP 2050 over IW 2050 was minimum in the UK, but 13% in NZ. Overall, mean yield potential of IP 2050 was 31% (5 t ha −1) greater in NZ than in the UK.
